Kutuzov turned away. The same smile of the eyes with which he had turned from Captain Tim6khin again flitted over his face. He turned away with a grimace as if to say that everything D61okhov had said to him and everything he could say had long been known to him, that he was weary of it and it was not at all what he wanted. He turned away and went to the car- riage.
